DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Tissue Donor Prior Harvest Procedure Enhance Collection Treat  Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the donor received treatment prior to any cell harvest to enhance the product (graft) collection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Tissue Donor Prior Harvest Procedure Enhance Collection Treat
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._Earlier in time or order._Remove from a culture or a living or dead body, as for the purposes of transplantation._To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Subject to a process with the aim of readying for some purpose, improving, or remedying a condition.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Property.preferredName: Prior Harvest Procedure Enhance Collection Treat
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Harvest; remove from a culture or a living or dead body, as for the purposes of transplantation.:To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.:The act of gathering something together.:Subject to a process with the aim of readying for some purpose, improving, or remedying a condition.

Concepts.definition: Remove from a culture or a living or dead body, as for the purposes of transplantation.
To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
Subject to a process with the aim of readying for some purpose, improving, or remedying a condition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.: Any division of quantity accepted as a standard of measurement or exchange.

Concepts.definition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.
A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants and cellular therapies for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
